author: steve rummell

review: This product works exactly as advertised, it is fast and very responsive. Integrates well with Amazon's services and the apps and games that are available for it work great. I own an Xbox One and use that or my Smart TV's when at home for accessing these content providers. I was looking for something similar to use when I travel (quite often) and this brings the best of both worlds. I was debating between this and the Roku Stick (which I tried, and is phenomenal by the way) I know its not apples to apples here, but I was really compelled by the Roku's small size. I eventually settled on the Fire TV because it has the ability to play games. It's like having a mini-Xbox in my suitcase (obviously the graphics are not the same, but you get the point...)The one star deduction is because some of the games (like sonic) though the controls are simple, require the additional amazon controller. I think the controller should be reserved for more complex games. Also the Wi-Fi is complicated to setup in a hotel environment because the Fire TV does not support the captive portals which are needed to register the device with the network. Calling the front desk usually works but it would be nice if this feature could be added in at some point.
